message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with the construction of error-correcting codes for distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several CS sub-fields such as information theory (cs.IT), distributed systems (cs.DS), data centers (cs.DC), and networked systems (cs.SI, cs.NI). Given that the paper focuses on the design of codes with optimal repair bandwidth, it is most likely to be classified under cs.IT and cs.DS. However, it also presents low-complexity encoding, decoding, and repair procedures, which could make it relevant to cs.DC. Finally, the paper discusses the error resilience capability of the constructed codes, which could be of interest to researchers in cs.SI and cs.NI.
